title: 104_hr3541
content: LAND EXCHANGE WITH CITY OF GREELEY, COLORADO, AND THE WATER SUPPLY AND STORAGE COMPANY. The Secretary of Agriculture shall transfer federal lands to the city of Greeley, Colorado, and The Water Supply and Storage Company in exchange for Rockwell Ranch and Timberline Lake properties. The city and company lands for exchange are specified on maps titled "Rockwell Ranch Property Land Exchange" and "Timberline Lake Property." The Rockwell Ranch property consists of 4 parcels totaling 520 acres, the Timberline Lake Property is a 10-acre parcel in Comanche Peak Wilderness, and the Cameron Pass Lands include 2 parcels totaling 178 acres owned by The Water Supply and Storage Company. Federal lands to be exchanged are specified as "Federal Exchange Lands" on maps. The Federal lands to be exchanged, known as "Federal Exchange Lands," encompass approximately 1,176 acres, including areas within the high water contour lines of various reservoirs with their dams and structures. This also includes a surcharge and operational access area around each reservoir. The Federal Exchange Lands include areas within the high water contour lines of reservoirs with their dams and structures, with specific projections and buffer zones outlined for each reservoir. A parcel of Federal land near Seaman Reservoir may be needed for a downstream damsite on the North Fork of the Cache la Poudre River. The terms and conditions related to a land exchange near Seaman Reservoir for a downstream damsite on the North Fork of the Cache la Poudre River are outlined in Section 2. The land exchange under section 1 involves granting perpetual access easements to the city of Greeley and The Water Supply and Storage Company. Easements for designated roads and trails must be reserved to ensure public access to adjoining National Forest lands. The city of Greeley and The Water Supply and Storage Company are required to maintain facilities accessible to visitors to the Roosevelt National Forest. Facilities accessible to visitors at Roosevelt National Forest include Chambers, Long Draw, Peterson, Barnes Meadow, Comanche, Seaman, and Twin Lakes Reservoirs. Special use permits and easements for Federal lands are rescinded upon completion of the exchange. Conditions for instream winter flows to Cache La Poudre River must be fulfilled regardless of land ownership. The land exchange with the United States Fish and Wildlife Service does not require further consultation or additional conditions, including instream flow requirements. The exchange does not include water rights owned by the city of Greeley, except for specific rights associated with the Rockwell Ranch property. The curr_chunk discusses the dedication of water rights to the Colorado Water Conservation Board for the instream flow program, as well as the exchange of Federal Exchange Lands to the city of Greeley and The Water Supply and Storage Company. The Secretary of Agriculture is authorized to conduct and approve all cadastral surveys for the land exchange. The exchange of Federal Exchange Lands to the city of Greeley and The Water Supply and Storage Company is deemed to be of approximately equal value without cash equalization. If reservoir operations are discontinued on acquired properties, the United States Forest Service will oversee the process. The Forest Service will be notified of the intent to breach the dam to permanently terminate reservoir operations. The United States Forest Service will have the opportunity to reacquire property at fair market value or exchange for a period not exceeding one year. The Federal lands to be exchanged are already developed and authorized for occupancy by the city of Greeley and The Water Supply and Storage Company. The Forest Service will grant a 20-year easement to the city of Greeley for use of an existing cabin in Section 30, Township 8 North, Range 72 West. The easement allows use of the cabin, other improvements, and access to nearby forest lands for recreational purposes. The Forest Service will grant a 20-year easement to the city of Greeley for use of an existing cabin in Jacks Gulch Campground on Pingree Road. The easement includes administrative use of the access road and reservation of the cabin for permitted individuals. The Rockwell Ranch, Timberline Lake, and Cameron Pass Lands acquired by the United States will be added to and managed as part of the Roosevelt National Forest. Portions within a wilderness area will be included and managed as part of the wilderness area. Additionally, there will be boundary modifications for the Arapaho National Forest and Roosevelt National Forest. The exterior boundaries of the Arapaho National Forest and Roosevelt National Forest are modified for more efficient administration of certain Federal lands. The maps and legal descriptions of the boundary changes will be available for public inspection. All Federal lands brought within the boundaries are added to the respective forests. The boundaries of Arapaho National Forest and Roosevelt National Forest are modified for efficient administration of Federal lands. The added lands will be governed by National Forest System laws. The modified boundaries will be considered as of January 1, 1965 for the Land and Water Conservation Act.
